definition: (of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
(of the sun) to scorch/to expose to a scorching sun
to sunbathe/to tan/to get sunburnt/to expose unfair practices (on a consumer protection website)
(idiom) to be exposed to the elements
scorched and drenched by sun and rain (idiom); suffer from exposure to the elements/weather-beaten
lit. to fish for three days and sun-dry the nets for two days (proverb)/fig. not to persevere in doing sth/to do sth by fits and starts
pinyin: san1 tian1 da3 yu2 , liang3 tian1 shai4 wang3

definition: to lay sth out to dry

sentences.english: While it was a great day, I got a bit sunburned in the water.
sentences.chinese: 今天过得很棒，但我在水里把自己给晒伤了。

sentences.english: After Sun Replenishing for Face and Décolleté.
Soothes and softens dry, irritated, chapped or sunburn skin.
sentences.chinese: 使干燥，敏感，粗糙以及晒后的皮肤柔润，富有弹性。

sentences.english: You will get sunburnt if you expose your skin to the sun too long.
sentences.chinese: 如果你将皮肤暴露在太阳底下太久，会被晒伤的。

sentences.english: He wanted to sunbathe rather than swim.
sentences.chinese: 他宁愿晒日光浴也不去游泳。

sentences.english: There were only a few dry bones left, bleached by the sun.
sentences.chinese: 一些被太阳晒得泛白的枯骨。

sentences.english: So the dishcloth to often take out, can destroy most bacteria.
sentences.chinese: 所以抹布要时常拿出来晒一下，就能消灭大部分细菌。

sentences.english: The hot sun made her exude sweat.
You need to get some sun.
I'll get the cast and go for sardines. Will you sit in the sun in the doorway?
sentences.chinese: 我拿鱼网捞沙丁鱼去。你坐在门口晒晒太阳可好？

sentences.english: The long , hot summer scorched the grass .
sentences.chinese: 炎热的长夏晒枯了青草。

sentences.english: Your face and neck are sunburned.
sentences.chinese: 你的脸还有脖子都晒伤了。

sentences.english: The sun is up. Time to get up.
sentences.chinese: 太阳都晒屁股啦，该起床了。

sentences.english: You'd better get the milk before it sours in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 你最好把牛奶拿进来，以免太阳晒了变酸。

sentences.english: Getting sunburnt on the first day sucks.
sentences.chinese: 入营第一天就被晒伤真让人郁闷。

sentences.english: Recently, websites such as sohu.com, set up special sections for people to "divulge their salaries".
sentences.chinese: 近日，搜狐等网站设立了一些所谓的“晒工资”专区。

definition: (coll.) to excessively share pics etc of one's child on social media/sharenting
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
to take a picture or video of oneself/to take a selfie/selfie
to make a public display of affection
to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
to lay sth out to dry
approved for distribution/to provide (wages etc) as usual (e.g. while an employee is on maternity leave)
to take a joint photo/group photo
